li.a: School Meal Program and Meal Charges
Do Your Part: Slow the Spread of Germs
Nebraska Department of Education COVID-19 Resources
Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services

p.span: Late last night Governor Ricketts issued a statewide Directed Health Measure (DHM) mandating that schools will not return to their normal status for the remainder of the school year and should continue to operate without students in their buildings. Schools must continue to conduct learning for their students online and/or with learning packets. Individuals will not be allowed into the buildings and all staff members are required to work from home and not report to the building.
As you know, with the temporary complete shutdown of the building until April 13
grade learning packets aren’t available to students. We are hoping to have new learning packets available to the students on Monday, April 13
. Mr. Kenton will contact parents as soon as we know the exact date when we’ll resume the learning packets.

Third through twelfth grade students will continue to work online in Schoology with their teachers. Schoology has had some issues lately with crashing. They’ve seen a 400% increase in the number of users in the last few weeks and that is overloading their system. They’ve assured us that this issue is being addressed and should be fixed within the next week. Parents, please make sure that your student is logging in on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays and completing their assignments.

The Board of Education will look at alternate dates to hold our graduation ceremony later in the summer. The date will be determined when local and state health officials determine it is safe to once again hold public gatherings. More information to come on this issue, but rest assured we will find a way to celebrate and honor our graduating seniors.

The school will continue to provide school lunches for those individuals who request them. You can go to the district website to fill out the Google document in the yellow highlighted area at the top of the page to request school lunches. Please remember that school lunches are available for curbside pick up at school from 11:30 to noon on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

It’s important at this time to reassure your student that they will get through this. Please help them get into a regular daily routine. Logging in to their Schoology class session’s helps them stay connected with their teachers and fellow students. Online contact with their classmates and teachers can go a long way of giving them a sense of normalcy and support. We have to continue their education the best we can under these trying circumstances. Speaking for all of the staff at the district, we’re here to help them through this tough time and we’ll be okay in the end.

div.div:
Monday, April 13th - 7:30pm

div.h4:
Click here to sign up for school meals.
Meals will be available for curbside pickup in the circle drive on MWF from 11:30am to noon.

h3.strong: Click here if you need options for discounted or free internet during this time of online education.

div.h3: April Student of the Month: Jenna Wooldridge

img.title: April Student of the Month: Jenna Wooldridge

li.h5: Parents can expect the best for their children at Shelton Public Schools.
Our staff combine their talents, innovation, dedication and energy to create a personalized, quality educational program.
Our goal is to maximize each child's intellectual potential and human development through formal instruction and by knowing each child individually, taking advantage of our small town setting.

div.h2: Four Elements Making Shelton Schools TRULY GREAT

a.span: Shelton Public Schools Official Mascot Graphic

div.span:
NONDISCRIMINATION Applicants for admission and employment, students, parents or elementary and secondary students, employees, sources of referral of applicants for admission and employment, and all unions or professional organizations holding collective bargaining or professional agreements with Shelton Public School are hereby notified that this institution does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, age, disability, or marital status in admission or access to, or treatment or employment in, its programs and activities. The superintendent has been designated by Shelton Public School to coordinate the institution's efforts to comply with the regulations implementing Title VI, Title IX and Section 504. Any person may also contact the Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights, U.S. Department of Education, regarding the institution's compliance with the regulations implementing Title VI, Title IX, or Section 504. The Shelton Public School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Superintendent Brian F. Gegg, 210 9th Street, PO Box 610, Shelton, NE 68876. Telephone number: 308-647-6742
